com.labyrinthdash

Class GameCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.labyrinthdash.GameObject
      • com.labyrinthdash.GameCell
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmptyCell, Platform

    public abstract class GameCell
extends GameObject
    GameCell is the parent class for all map cells in the game. It's primary purpose is to provide structure to it's children classes and to provide a universal segment collision function for the children to use. All but one of the global variables in this class are solely used in segmentCollision to minimize the creation of variables for each iteration of the function.
    Author:
    Isaac Doub

      • segmentCollision

        protected boolean segmentCollision(Vector2D P1,
                       Vector2D P2,
                       GamePlayer player)
        Calculates whether the player will collide with a segment in between this frame and the next.

        This class is quite complicated and uses a lot of vector trigonometry in it's calculations. It's core functionality is based on Seb Lee-Delisle's post at http://seb.ly/2010/01/predicting-circle-line-collisions/ with a lot of modifications to make it work and to optimize it.

        Parameters:
        P1 - First segment point
        P2 - Second segment point
        player - GamePlayer to check collision with
        Returns:
        true if it collided, false if it didn't

      • hasCollided

        protected abstract boolean hasCollided(GamePlayer player)
        Abstract class to force standard collision method. Each cell should cycle through it's segments, using segmentCollision() to check for collision and modifying the player's velocity accordingly.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        true if collided, false if didn't
